greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Lexicographically earliest such sequence a that a(i) = a(j) => f(i) = f(j) for all i, j, where f(n) = -(n mod 2) if n is a prime, and f(n) = A300840(n) for any other number.
comment: Like the related A322822 also this filter sequence satisfies the following two implications, for all i, j >= 1:
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..65539
program: rgs_transform(invec) = { my(om = Map(), outvec = vector(length(invec)), u=1); for(i=1, length(invec), if(mapisdefined(om,invec[i]), my(pp = mapget(om, invec[i])); outvec[i] = outvec[pp] , mapput(om,invec[i],i); outvec[i] = u; u++ )); outvec; };
A050376list(up_to) = { my(v=vector(up_to), i=0); for(n=1,oo,if(A302777(n), i++; v[i] = n); if(i == up_to,return(v))); };
A052331(n) = { my(s=0,e); while(n > 1, fordiv(n, d, if(((n/d)>1)&&A302777(n/d), e = vecsearch(v050376, n/d); if(!e, print("v050376 too short!"); return(1/0)); s += 2^(e-1); n = d; break))); (s); };
results.author: _Antti Karttunen_, Jan 04 2019
